title: House antitrust panel nears final steps in its investigation of Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google
text: The House Judiciary subcommittee on antitrust held its final hearing in a series examining the state of competition in digital markets.

title: Librarian Capital's Monthly Top Buys And Price Moves - September 2020
text: We highlight the most attractive opportunities this month, by reviewing notable price moves and rating changes in our research.

title: 3 Reasons to Buy the Dip in Facebook Stock
text: When Facebook stock goes on sale, investors need to pay attention. The growth and balance sheet are simply too impressive to ignore.

title: Senate committee will subpoena Facebook, Twitter, Google CEOs to testify
text: Mark Zuckerberg, Jack Dorsey and Sundar Pichai are going back to Washington. The Senate Commerce Committee on Thursday voted unanimously to approve a plan to subpoena the CEOs of Facebook, Twitter and Google for a hearing on the legal immunities that protect the biggest names in Silicon Valley.

title: Facebook sues two companies engaged in data scraping operations
text: Facebook today says it has filed a lawsuit in the U.S. against two companies that had engaged in an international “data scraping” operation.

title: 7 U.S. Tech Stocks To Sell After Their September Slide
text: The 'tech wreck' led to a serious shakeout among technology companies and some might not recover. Here are seven stocks to consider selling.

title: Facebook won’t accept ads that ‘delegitimize’ U.S. election results
text: Following a particularly dark and vivid display of the threats to the 2020 U.S. election during Tuesday’s first presidential debate, Facebook has further clarified its new rules around election-related ads.

title: Facebook will push more users to discover and join groups
text: Facebook on Thursday announced several new features for groups, including new ways the service will recommend public groups to users.

title: Senate Prepares To Subpoena Tech CEOs Over Social Media’s Legal Shield
text: Democrats and Republicans both want to change legal protections for tech companies, but they disagree sharply on the types of reforms.

title: Cruz on Big Tech: There has never been such an aggregation of power
text: CNBC's Ylan Mui joins "Squawk Alley" with the latest on top tech CEOs including Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg, Alphabet's Sundar Pichai and Twitter's Jack Dorsey being subpoenaed by Congress to come back to Capitol Hill.

title: Senate Commerce votes to issue subpoenas to CEOs of Facebook, Google and Twitter
text: The Senate Commerce Committee voted unanimously on Thursday to issue subpoenas to the CEOs of Facebook, Google and Twitter, in Washington's latest attack on Big Tech.

title: Facebook to reject ads that delegitimize election results
text: Yahoo Finance's Ines Ferre breaks down the latest news on Facebook's efforts to combat election misinformation.

title: Senate panel approves sending subpoenas to CEOs of Twitter, Facebook, Google
text: The U.S. Senate Commerce Committee on Thursday unanimously voted to approve a plan to subpoena chief executives of Twitter, Alphabet's Google and Facebook for a hearing likely to be held before the election on a prized legal immunity enjoyed by internet companies.

title: Senate prepares to subpoena social media CEOs
text: Senate committee prepares to subpoena Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Google CEO Sundar Pichai.

title: Facebook's Workplace partners Deloitte to help companies work remotely
text: Facebook on Thursday announced a global alliance with Deloitte to help companies to use the social media group's Workplace tool to meet the challenges of remote working.

title: Senate committee votes to subpoena CEOs of Facebook, Google and Twitter to testify
text: The Senate Commerce Committee Thursday voted on a bipartisan basis to subpoena the CEOs of Facebook, Google and Twitter to testify.

title: Big Tech stocks close out a 'nightmare' September
text: September has been a tough month for traders overall, but a perfect storm left big tech stocks, a sector that normally leads the market, with losses.

title: Facebook Says No To Ads That Undermine US Election Results
text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) said Wednesday it is prohibiting advertisements that undermine the outcome of the upcoming presidential elections. What Happened: The Mark Zuckerberg-led company said in a statement that the advertising restrictions would be in place between Oct. 27 and Nov. 3.
